spanish: ¿Cuál es la diferencia entre un pueblo y una ciudad?

spanish: ¿Cuál es la parte más importante de una buena educación?

spanish: ¿Qué número tiene el fax de este hotel?

english: Whatever you may say, I will not change my opinion.
spanish: Digas lo que digas, no cambiaré de opinión.

english: When I came home, my sister was playing the guitar.
spanish: Cuando vine a casa, mi hermana estaba tocando la guitarra.

spanish: Cuando entré a la habitación, ella estaba tocando el piano.

english: When I realized it was raining, I took my umbrella.
spanish: Tomé mi paraguas en cuanto me di cuenta de que estaba lloviendo.

english: When I see you, you always remind me of my brother.
spanish: Siempre que te veo me recuerdas a mi hermano.

english: When I see you, you always remind me of my brother.
spanish: Cuando te veo, siempre me recuerdas a mi hermano.

english: When I told him that, he was very much embarrassed.
spanish: Cuando se lo dije se azaró mucho.

english: Whenever I try to get near her, she pushes me away.
spanish: Siempre que intento acercarme a ella, me aparta.

english: Whether rains or not, the game is going to be held.
spanish: Se va a celebrar el partido tanto si llueve como si no.

english: Whether you like it or not, the job has to be done.
spanish: El trabajo debe hacerse, se quiera o no.

english: Whether you like it or not, you must do it at once.
spanish: Tanto si te gusta como si no, debes hacerlo ahora mismo.

english: Which do you like better, the sea or the mountains?
spanish: ¿Qué preferís? ¿El mar o la montaña?

english: Who was that girl you were with at the beach today?
spanish: ¿Quién era esa chica con la que estabas hoy en la playa?

english: Who was that sitting in front of you at the movies?
spanish: ¿Quién estaba sentado delante de usted en el cine?

english: Why do you think Tom prefers living in the country?
spanish: ¿Por qué piensas que Tom prefiere vivir en el campo?

english: Why do you want to know what we are thinking about?
spanish: ¿Por qué quieres saber en qué estamos pensando?

english: Why would your opinion be more important than mine?
spanish: ¿Por qué va a ser tu opinión más importante que la mía?

english: Why would your opinion be more important than mine?
spanish: ¿Por qué debería ser tu opinión más importante que la mía?

english: With a little more effort, he would have succeeded.
spanish: Con un poco más de esfuerzo él lo hubiera conseguido.

english: With a little more effort, he would have succeeded.
spanish: Si se hubiera esforzado un poco más, hubiera tenido éxito.

english: Would you like to go out to have a drink somewhere?
spanish: ¿Te gustaría que nos fuéramos a tomar una copa en alguna parte?

english: Would you like to go out to have a drink somewhere?
spanish: ¿Te gustaría salir a tomar algo a alguna parte?

english: Would you like to hear the story about Paul Bunyan?
spanish: ¿Te gustaría oír la historia de Paul Bunyan?

spanish: ¿Os gustaría oír la historia de Paul Bunyan?

english: Would you mind giving me a ride to the post office?
spanish: ¿Le importaría darme un aventón a la oficina de correos?

english: You are working too hard. Take it easy for a while.
spanish: Estás trabajando demasiado duro. Relájate un rato.

english: You are working too hard. Take it easy for a while.
spanish: Estás trabajando demasiado. Relájate un tiempo.

english: You are working too hard. Take it easy for a while.
spanish: Estás trabajando muy duro. Tómelo con calma por un tiempo.

english: You are working too hard. Take it easy for a while.
spanish: Creo que será mejor que te pongas a dieta.

english: You came here because you wanted to know the truth.
spanish: Viniste aquí porque querías saber la verdad.

english: You came here because you wanted to know the truth.
spanish: Viniste aquí porque querías averiguar la verdad.

english: You can make a cake with flour and milk and an egg.
spanish: Puedes hacer una tarta con harina, leche y un huevo.

english: You can't enter that bookstore with your shirt off.
spanish: No puedes entrar en la librería sin camiseta.

english: You can't learn a language without making mistakes.
spanish: No puedes aprender un idioma sin cometer errores.

english: You don't have to do anything you don't want to do.
spanish: No tenés que hacer nada que no quieras hacer.

english: You don't have to get married if you don't want to.
spanish: No tenés que casarte si no querés.

english: You don't have to get married if you don't want to.
spanish: No tienes que casarte si no quieres.

english: You have only a short rest, so make the best of it.
spanish: Tienes sólo un pequeño descanso, así que disfrútalo.

english: You have to look out for other cars when you drive.
spanish: Tienes que poner ojo con los otros vehículos cuando conduzcas.

english: You know me well enough to know I wouldn't do that.
spanish: Me conoces lo suficientemente bien para saber que yo no lo haría.

english: You must also respect the opinions of the minority.
spanish: También debes respetar las opiniones de la minoría.

english: You must consider what kind of work you want to do.
spanish: Deberías pensar qué clase de trabajo quieres hacer.

english: You must consider what kind of work you want to do.
spanish: Deberíais pensar qué clase de trabajo queréis hacer.

english: You must consider what kind of work you want to do.
spanish: Debes pensar qué clase de trabajo deseas hacer.

english: You must make an effort to get along with everyone.
spanish: Tienes que hacer un esfuerzo y llevarte bien con todos.

english: You must remove your shoes before entering a house.
spanish: Tú debes quitarte los zapatos antes de entrar a una casa.

english: You need a bat, a ball and gloves to play baseball.
spanish: Necesitas un bate, una pelota y guantes para jugar al béisbol.

english: You never listen. I might as well talk to the wall.
spanish: Nunca escuchas. Es como hablarle a una pared.

english: You said almost all of your friends were Canadians.
spanish: Dijiste que casi todos tus amigos eran canadienses.

english: You should always knock before entering Tom's room.
spanish: Siempre deberías golpear la puerta antes de entrar a la habitación de Tom.

english: You should make sure that you don't make Tom angry.
spanish: Deberías asegurarte de no hacer enfadar a Tom.

english: You should tell Tom that Mary isn't planning to go.
spanish: Deberías decirle a Tom que Mary no está planeando ir.

english: You shouldn't interfere in other people's business.
spanish: No deberías interferir en los asuntos de otras personas.

english: You shouldn't look down on a person for being poor.
spanish: No deberías mirar por encima del hombro a una persona por ser pobre.

english: You shouldn't talk about people behind their backs.
spanish: No debes hablar de la gente a sus espaldas.

english: You talk so fast I can't understand a word you say.
spanish: Hablas tan rápido que no puedo entender una palabra de lo que dices.

english: You were just in the wrong place at the wrong time.
spanish: Estabas justamente en el lugar equivocado en el momento equivocado.

english: You will save time if you adopt this new procedure.
spanish: Ahorrarán tiempo si ustedes adoptan este nuevo procedimiento.

english: You'll all get used to the cold climate in no time.
spanish: Os acostumbraréis rápido al clima frío.

english: You're going to come up against fierce competition.
spanish: Va usted a tener una competencia feroz.

english: You're going to come up against fierce competition.
spanish: Te vas a enfrentar a una competencia feroz.

english: You're the most beautiful woman in the whole world.
spanish: Eres las mujer más bella en todo el mundo.

english: You're the only person I know who has a sports car.
spanish: Eres la única persona que conozco que tiene un deportivo.

english: You're tired, aren't you? Why don't you get to bed?
spanish: Estás cansado, ¿verdad? ¿Por qué no vas a la cama?

english: Young men and women fought to defend their country.
spanish: Hombres y mujeres jóvenes lucharon para defender a su país.

english: "Do you have any siblings?" "No, I'm an only child."
spanish: "¿Tienes algún hermano?" "No, soy hijo único."

english: "Let's dance together." "I thought you'd never ask."
spanish: "Bailemos juntos." "Pensé que jamás preguntarías."

english: "Let's dance together." "I thought you'd never ask."
spanish: «Ven a bailar conmigo.» «Creía que no me lo pedirías nunca.»

english: "May I help you?" "No, thank you. I'm just looking."
spanish: "¿Puedo ayudarlo?" "No, gracias. Solo estoy mirando."

english: "May I help you?" "No, thank you. I'm just looking."
spanish: "¿Puedo ayudarla?" "No, gracias. Solo estoy mirando."

english: "My father doesn't drink." "Neither does my father."
spanish: "Mi padre no bebe alcohol." "El mío tampoco."

english: A beautiful woman was seated one row in front of me.
spanish: Una hermosa mujer estaba sentada una fila delante de mí.

english: A caged cricket eats just as much as a free cricket.
spanish: Un grillo enjaulado come tanto como un grillo libre.

english: A clear conscience is the sure sign of a bad memory.
spanish: Una consciencia limpia es una señal clara de una mala memoria.

english: A drunk driver was responsible for the car accident.
spanish: Un conductor ebrio fue responsable del accidente.

english: A lot of people are coming out of the movie theater.
spanish: Mucha gente está saliendo del cine.

english: A lot of people are now trying to sell their houses.
spanish: Ahora mucha gente está intentando vender sus casas.

english: A lot of people look up to you. Don't let them down.
spanish: Mucha gente te admira. No los decepciones.

english: A man who wanted to see you came while you were out.
spanish: Un señor que queria verte vino mientra estabas fuera.

english: A man who wanted to see you came while you were out.
spanish: Mientras estabas fuera un señor vino porque te quería ver.

english: A man who wanted to see you came while you were out.
spanish: Mientras estabas fuera un señor vino porque quería verte.

english: A man's worth has nothing to do with his appearance.
spanish: El valor de un hombre no tiene nada que ver con su apariencia.

english: A wide leather belt would look good with that dress.
spanish: Un grueso cinturón de cuero quedaría bien con ese vestido.

english: After months of looking, Mary purchased a new dress.
spanish: Tras meses de búsqueda, Mary se ha comprado un nuevo vestido.

english: After some hesitation, he laid the book on the desk.
spanish: Tras algo de vacilación, él puso el libro sobre el escritorio.

english: After the dog died, they buried him in the backyard.
spanish: Cuando murió el perro, lo enterraron en el jardín.

english: All life support systems have been severely damaged.
spanish: Todos los sistemas de soporte vital han sido gravemente dañados.

english: All students are free to use the university library.
spanish: Todos los estudiantes tienen libertad para hacer uso de la biblioteca universitaria.

spanish: Los estadounidenses votan a un nuevo presidente cada cuatro años.

english: As of tomorrow, this e-mail address will be invalid.
spanish: A partir de mañana, esta dirección de correo electrónico será inválida.

english: At Narita Airport, I ran into an old friend of mine.
spanish: En el Aeropuerto Narita, me topé con un viejo amigo mío.

english: At such times, I think of my family, not my friends.
spanish: En esos momentos es en mi familia en quien pienso, no en mis amigos.

english: At such times, I think of my family, not my friends.
spanish: En esos momentos, pienso en mi familia, no en mis amigos.

english: At that time, Tom was sitting between Mary and John.
spanish: En aquel momento, Tom estaba sentado entre Mary y John.

spanish: La energía atómica puede ser utilizada para propósitos pacíficos.

english: Attach a recent photograph to your application form.
spanish: Adjunte una fotografía reciente a su formulario de solicitud.

english: Be careful of what you say, for he's easily annoyed.
spanish: Ten cuidado con lo que dices porque se molesta muy fácilmente.

english: Be careful what you wish for. You just might get it.
spanish: Cuidado con lo que deseas. Porque se podría cumplir.

english: Because of the dense haze, the road was hard to see.
spanish: A causa de la densa neblina, el camino era difícil de ver.

english: By the time I get home I'll be too tired to do that.
spanish: A la hora que llegue a casa estaré demasiado cansado para hacer eso.

english: By the time I get home I'll be too tired to do that.
spanish: A la hora que llegue a casa estaré demasiado cansado para hacerlo.

english: Can you please take this package to the post office?
spanish: ¿Puedes llevar este paquete a la oficina de correos?

spanish: ¿Pueden llevar este paquete a la oficina de correos?

english: Compared with his brother, he is not so intelligent.
spanish: Comparado con su hermano, no es tan inteligente.

english: Could you lend me your bicycle for a couple of days?
spanish: ¿Podrías prestarme tu bicicleta por un par de días?

spanish: ¿Podrías cerrar la ventana, por favor? Aquí hace frío.

spanish: ¿Podrías decirme cómo llegar a la estación más cercana?

english: Curiously, a flower bloomed on the withered up tree.
spanish: Curiosamente, una flor floreció en el árbol marchito.

english: Dad says the most important thing is that I'm alive.
spanish: Papá dice que lo más importante es que estoy vivo.

english: Did you know that some foxes lived on this mountain?
spanish: ¿Sabía usted que algunos zorros vivían en esta montaña?

english: Do you have a shoe box where I can put these things?
spanish: ¿Usted tiene una caja de zapatos vacía para que yo pueda poner estas cosas?

spanish: ¿Tienes alguna caja de zapatos donde pueda poner estas cosas?

english: Do you have any idea how stupid this makes you look?
spanish: ¿Acaso tienes idea de lo estúpido que te hace ver esto?

english: Do you know where tomorrow's meeting is going to be?
spanish: ¿Sabes dónde será la reunión de mañana?

english: Do you know where tomorrow's meeting is going to be?
spanish: ¿Sabes dónde va a ser la reunión mañana?

english: Do you remember the time we went to Boston together?
spanish: ¿Recuerdas esa vez que fuimos juntos a Boston?

english: Do you think we'll have a white Christmas this year?
spanish: ¿Crees que tendremos una Navidad blanca este año?

spanish: ¿Quieres oír lo que esa persona dijo sobre ti?

english: Does depreciation of the yen give rise to inflation?
spanish: ¿Genera inflación la depreciación del yen?

english: Does every boy have to learn cooking in your school?
spanish: ¿Todos los chicos de tu escuela tienen que aprender a cocinar?

english: Don't feel bad. Tom didn't give me a present either.
spanish: No te sientas mal. Tom tampoco me dio a mí ningún regalo.

english: Don't forget to polish your shoes before you go out!
spanish: ¡No olvides lustrar tus zapatos antes de salir!

english: Don't leave your belongings unattended at the beach.
spanish: No dejes tus pertenencias desatendidas en el playa.

english: Don't translate English into Japanese word for word.
spanish: No traduzcas inglés a japonés palabra por palabra.

english: Don't worry about it. Everything's going to be fine.
spanish: No preocupes por eso. Todo saldrá bien.

english: Don't you have anything better to do with your time?
spanish: ¿No tienes nada mejor que hacer con tu tiempo?

english: Don't you think you should be a little more careful?
spanish: ¿No crees que deberías ser un poco más cuidadoso?

english: Don't you think you should be a little more careful?
spanish: ¿No crees que deberías tener un poco más de cuidado?

english: During that month, he had no money on which to live.
spanish: Para mantenerse durante aquel mes no tenía dinero.

english: Early education for children usually begins at home.
spanish: La educación temprana de los niños normalmente empieza en el hogar.

english: Employees are prohibited from watching the Olympics.
spanish: Los empleados tienen prohibido ver las Olimpiadas.

english: Even intelligent people are sometimes absent-minded.
spanish: Hasta las personas inteligentes son distraídas a veces.

english: Even intelligent people are sometimes absent-minded.
spanish: Incluso las personas inteligentes son a veces distraídas.

english: Even the cleverest students can make silly mistakes.
spanish: Incluso los estudiantes más inteligentes pueden cometer errores estúpidos.

english: Every time I see this picture, I remember my father.
spanish: Siempre que miro este cuadro pienso en mi padre.

english: Everybody knows you're more intelligent than she is.
spanish: Todo el mundo sabe que eres más inteligente que ella.

english: Everyone except Tom and Mary have already gone home.
spanish: Ya se han ido todos a casa excepto Tom y Mary.

english: Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence.
spanish: Afirmaciones extraordinarias requieren evidencias extraordinarias.

english: Father translated the French document into Japanese.
spanish: Mi padre tradujo el documento francés al japonés.

english: First of all, you must look it up in the dictionary.
spanish: Primero que todo, debes buscarlo en el diccionario.

english: Flies and mosquitoes interfered with his meditation.
spanish: Las moscas y mosquitos interferían con su meditación.

english: Focus your attention on the really important things.
spanish: ¡Centra tu atención en las cosas verdaderamente importantes!

english: For all Tom knew, Mary might be in Boston with John.
spanish: Según la información de Tom, Mary podría estar en Boston con John.

english: For the past 10 years, I've fed my dog dry dog food.
spanish: Durante los últimos 10 años, he dado de comer a mi perro alimento seco para perros.

english: French people don't think of anything as impossible.
spanish: Los franceses creen que nada es imposible.

english: From his accent, I would guess that man is Scottish.
spanish: Por su acento, supongo que ese hombre es escocés.

english: Germany is one of Europe's most beautiful countries.
spanish: Alemania es uno de los países más bonitos de Europa.

english: Germs can only be seen with the aid of a microscope.
spanish: Los microbios sólo pueden ser observados con la ayuda de un microscopio.

english: Get back before midnight, or you will be locked out.
spanish: Vuelve antes de la medianoche o te vas a quedar encerrado afuera.

english: Give me five minutes to finish the last adjustments.
spanish: Dame cinco minutos para completar los últimos ajustes.

english: Give me your passport, Tom. I'll keep it in my safe.
spanish: Dame tu pasaporte, Tom. Lo guardaré en la caja fuerte.

english: Go wake up Tom and tell him that breakfast is ready.
spanish: Andá a despertar a Tom y decile que el desayuno está listo.

english: Good words are worth a lot, but cost almost nothing.
spanish: Las buenas palabras valen mucho y cuestan poco.

english: Has Tom told Mary that he can't speak French at all?
spanish: ¿Le ha dicho Tom a Mary que no puede hablar francés para nada?

english: Have you been fighting with the boy next door again?
spanish: ¿Has estado peleando con el muchacho de al lado otra vez?

english: Have you been fighting with the boy next door again?
spanish: ¿Te has estado embolillando con el guaro de al lado otra vez?

english: Have you been told when you are expected to be here?
spanish: ¿Te dijeron cuándo se espera que te presentes?

english: Have you given any thought to having dinner with me?
spanish: ¿Has pensado en cenar conmigo?

english: He always takes his time in everything that he does.
spanish: Él siempre se toma su tiempo en todo lo que hace.

english: He became more mature with the passing of the years.
spanish: Maduró con los años.

english: He borrowed money from the bank to finance his home.
spanish: Él pidió prestado dinero al banco para comprar una casa nueva.

english: He brushed up his English during his stay in London.
spanish: Él pulió su inglés durante su estancia en Londres.

english: He buttoned up his coat before walking out the door.
spanish: Él se abotonó el abrigo antes de salir por la puerta.

english: He came from one of the richest families in America.
spanish: Vino de una de las familias más ricas de América.

english: He caught my hand and pulled me to the second floor.
spanish: Él tomó mi mano y me arrastró hasta el segundo piso.

english: He considered his options carefully before deciding.
spanish: Él consideró cuidadosamente sus opciones antes de decidirse.

english: He couldn't make up his mind which course to follow.
spanish: Él no conseguía decidir qué dirección tomar.

english: He did not answer the phone, so I sent him an email.
spanish: No respondió al teléfono, así que le mandé un correo.

english: He fell asleep behind the wheel and had an accident.
spanish: Él se durmió al volante y sufrió un accidente.

english: He gave us such a long assignment that we protested.
spanish: Nos asignó una tarea tan extensa que protestamos.

english: He has a wife and two young children to provide for.
spanish: Él tiene una esposa y dos niños pequeños que mantener.

english: He hid in the bushes so that they would not see him.
spanish: Se escondió en los matorrales para que no lo vieran.

english: He is a gentleman. He cannot have said such a thing.
spanish: Él es un caballero. No puede haber dicho algo así.

english: He is happy about the progress he has recently made.
spanish: Él está contento por el avance que ha hecho en el último tiempo.

english: He is one of the most popular students in the class.
spanish: Él es uno de los estudiantes más populares de la clase.

english: He is such a bad person that everybody dislikes him.
spanish: Él es una persona tan mala que todos lo odian.

english: He made heaps of money by ripping off naive suckers.
spanish: Hizo un montón de dinero estafando a primos ingenuos.

english: He made up his mind to write in his diary every day.
spanish: Él decidió escribir en su diario todos los días.

english: He missed the train because of the traffic accident.
spanish: Perdió el tren debido al accidente de tráfico.

english: He practices playing the guitar until late at night.
spanish: Él practica guitarra hasta tarde por la noche.

english: He ran and ran, but could not catch up with his dog.
spanish: Él corrió y corrió, pero no pudo alcanzar a su perro.

english: He told his mother that he would study the next day.
spanish: Él le dijo a su madre que estudiaría al día siguiente.

english: He took a look at the newspaper before going to bed.
spanish: Él echó un vistazo al periódico antes de irse a la cama.

english: He took care of his mother after his father's death.
spanish: Él cuidó a su madre después de la muerte de su padre.

english: He took charge of the firm after his father's death.
spanish: Él se hizo cargo de la empresa después de la muerte de su padre.

english: He was a former university professor and researcher.
spanish: Era un antiguo profesor universitario e investigador.

english: He was born in England, but was educated in America.
spanish: Nació en Inglaterra, pero se educó en América.

english: He was strong enough to help his father on the farm.
spanish: Era lo suficientemente fuerte como para ayudar a su padre en la granja.

english: He was very kind to invite me to his birthday party.
spanish: Fue tan amable como para invitarme a su fiesta de cumpleaños.

english: He was wrong in thinking that she'd come to see him.
spanish: Él se equivocaba al pensar que ella vendría a verle.

english: He will look after the cats for me while I'm abroad.
spanish: Él cuidará los gatos mientras estoy en el extranjero.

english: He'll never achieve anything unless he works harder.
spanish: Él nunca logrará nada a menos que trabaje más duro.

english: He's been confined to bed for the past three months.
spanish: Está enfermo en cama desde hace tres meses.

english: He's been staying at that hotel since five days ago.
spanish: Se ha quedado en ese hotel desde hace cinco días.

english: Her feet were bare, as was the custom in those days.
spanish: Sus pies estaban descalzos, como era la costumbre en esos días.

english: Her husband wants to have his own way in everything.
spanish: Su marido quiere hacerlo todo a su manera.

english: Her ideas on education are very different from mine.
spanish: Sus ideas en educación son muy diferentes de las mías.

english: Hey, I may have no money, but I still have my pride.
spanish: ¡Eh! Puede que no tenga dinero, pero todavía tengo mi orgullo.

english: How did you find out that Tom hadn't paid his bills?
spanish: ¿Cómo averiguaste que Tom no había pagado sus cuentas?

english: How do I explain it so that everyone understands it?
spanish: ¿Cómo lo explico para que todos puedan entenderlo?

english: How long does it take from the airport to the hotel?
spanish: ¿Cuánto se tarda del aeropuerto al hotel?

english: How much longer will I have to stay in the hospital?

spanish: Disfruté el concierto, excepto que el pasillo estaba frío.

english: I found this book interesting from beginning to end.
spanish: He encontrado interesante este libro de principio a fin.

spanish: Le di una advertencia, a la que no prestó atención.

english: I gave him three textbooks in exchange for his help.
spanish: Le di tres libros de texto a cambio de su ayuda.

english: I get very angry when you don't answer my questions.
spanish: Me enfado mucho cuando no responden a mis preguntas.

spanish: Tenía una habitación con una hermosa vista de las montañas.

spanish: Volví a mi ciudad natal después de cinco años de ausencia.

spanish: Es un error pensar que los hombres son superiores a las mujeres.

spanish: Me duele tener que decir esto, pero es la verdad.

spanish: Parece que él llegó atrasado a la reunión de ayer.

spanish: Cuesta mucho dinero mantener una casa tan grande.

spanish: No me sorprendería si Tomás y María se casan.

spanish: Es mejor enfriar el vino blanco antes de servirlo.

spanish: Kioto recibe muchos turistas de todo el mundo.

spanish: Se podía ver el lago Biwa desde donde estábamos parados.

spanish: El lenguaje es la más importante invención del ser humano.

spanish: Se usaron grandes sumas de dinero en el nuevo puente.

english: You keep on making the same mistake time after time.
spanish: Tú sigues cometiendo el mismo error una y otra vez.

english: You may take this book as long as you keep it clean.
spanish: Puedes tomar este libro siempre y cuando lo mantengas limpio.

english: You must not speak ill of others behind their backs.
spanish: No debes hablar mal a espaldas de los demás.

english: You must not think about your immediate profit only.
spanish: No debes pensar solo en la recompensa inmediata.

english: You need to have give-and-take in your relationship.
spanish: Necesitas más dar-y-recibir en tu relación.

english: You should acquaint yourself with the local customs.
spanish: Deberías familiarizarte con las costumbres locales.

english: You should confer with your attorney on this matter.
spanish: Deberías consultar con tu abogado sobre este asunto.

english: You should have told him about it while he was here.
spanish: Deberías haberle dicho mientras estaba aquí.

english: You should see this film if you get the opportunity.
spanish: Deberías ver la película si tienes la oportunidad.

english: You should turn off the light before going to sleep.
spanish: Deberías apagar la luz antes de irte a dormir.

english: You should watch your language when you talk to her.
spanish: Deberías moderar tu lenguaje cuando hablás con ella.

english: You shouldn't eat garlic before going out on a date.
spanish: Usted no debería comer ajo antes de ir a una cita.

english: You still haven't told me why you decided not to go.
spanish: Aún no me has dicho por qué decidiste no ir.

english: You're asking me to do something I don't want to do.
spanish: Me estás pidiendo que haga algo que no quiero hacer.

english: You're not an expert at this job any more than I am.
spanish: Tu no eres más experto que yo en este trabajo.

english: Your friends are really concerned about your health.
spanish: Tus amigos están muy interesados por tu salud.

english: "Are you going to Tom's party?" "I'm still not sure."
spanish: «¿Vas a ir a la fiesta de Tom?» «Todavía no estoy seguro.»

english: "Are you going to Tom's party?" "I'm still not sure."
spanish: «¿Vas a ir a la fiesta de Tom?» «Todavía no estoy segura.»

english: "Would you mind shutting the door?" "No, not at all."
spanish: ¿Le importaría cerrar la puerta? No, en absoluto.

english: A bad habit, once formed, is difficult to get rid of.
spanish: Es difícil deshacerse de un mal hábito, cuando éste ya ha arraigado.

english: A beautiful woman like you shouldn't be eating alone.
spanish: Una mujer tan hermosa como tú no debería comer sola.

english: A lot of countries participated in the Olympic Games.
spanish: Muchos países participaron en las Olimpiadas.

english: A lot of people think that lawyers get paid too much.
spanish: Mucha gente opina que los abogados cobran demasiado.

english: A number of countries have strict laws against drugs.
spanish: Varios países tienen leyes estrictas contra las drogas.

english: A number of traffic accidents have happened recently.
spanish: Han habido un número de accidentes de tráfico recientemente.

english: A person like Tom probably knows how to speak French.
spanish: Una persona como Tomás probablemente sabe cómo hablar en francés.

english: A selfish man thinks of nothing but his own feelings.
spanish: Alguien egoísta no piensa en nada más que sus propios sentimientos.

english: A selfish man thinks of nothing but his own feelings.
spanish: Un hombre egoísta sólo piensa en sus propios sentimientos.

english: A winter sport that many people enjoy is ice skating.
spanish: Un deporte de invierno con el que mucha gente disfruta es el patinaje.

english: About this time tomorrow, we'll be climbing Mt. Fuji.
spanish: Mañana a estas horas estaremos escalando el monte Fuji.

english: According to the newspaper, it's going to rain today.
spanish: Según el periódico, va a llover hoy.

english: After eating, the first thing I do is brush my teeth.
spanish: Después de comer, lo primero que hago es cepillarme los dientes.

english: After he finished supper, he began to read the novel.
spanish: Tras terminar de cenar, empezó a leer la novela.

english: After she had read the letter, she tore it to pieces.
spanish: Después de leer la carta, la rompió en pedacitos.

english: Agriculture was developed more than 10,000 years ago.
spanish: La agricultura fue desarrollada hace más de 10.000 años.

english: All humanity will suffer if a nuclear war breaks out.
spanish: Toda la humanidad sufrirá si se desata una guerra nuclear.

english: All my friends like the same kind of music that I do.
spanish: A todos mis amigos les gusta el mismo tipo de música que a mí.

english: All the roads leading into the city are full of cars.
spanish: Todas las calles que conducen a la ciudad están abarrotadas de vehículos.

english: Although my car is very old, it still runs very well.
spanish: A pesar de ser muy viejo, mi coche todavía va muy bien.

english: Although my car is very old, it still runs very well.
spanish: Aunque mi coche es muy viejo, sigue funcionando muy bien.

english: Although she was tired, she tried to finish the work.
spanish: Aunque estaba cansada, trató de terminar el trabajo.

english: Always keep a bucket of water handy, in case of fire.
spanish: Siempre mantén un balde de agua a mano, en caso de un incendio.

english: American kitchens are much bigger than Japanese ones.
spanish: Las cocinas americanas son mucho más grandes que las japonesas.

english: Anticipating a cold winter, we bought a bigger stove.
spanish: Anticipándonos al frío invierno, compramos un calefactor más grande.

english: Are you seriously thinking about buying that old car?
spanish: ¿Estás pensando seriamente en comprar ese cacharro?

english: Are you seriously thinking about selling this online?
spanish: ¿Estás pensando seriamente en vender esto en línea?

english: Around here, they roll up the sidewalks at 7 o'clock.
spanish: Aquí las calles están desiertas a partir de las siete.

english: Around here, they roll up the sidewalks at 7 o'clock.
spanish: A las siete de la tarde, las calles están desiertas en esta ciudad.

english: As great a scientist as he is, he lacks common sense.
spanish: Para lo gran científico que es, carece de sentido común.

english: As is often the case with her, she broke her promise.
spanish: Como suele ser el caso con ella, rompió su promesa.

english: As is often the case with teenagers, she's conceited.
spanish: Como es a menudo el caso con los adolescentes, ella es orgullosa.

english: As long as good people do nothing, evil will triumph.
spanish: Mientras las buenas personas no hagan nada, el mal triunfará.

english: As soon as we find out anything, we will contact him.
spanish: Lo contactaremos, tan pronto descubramos algo.

english: As soon as we find out anything, we will contact you.
spanish: Te contactaremos tan pronto averigüemos cualquier cosa.

english: As soon as you arrive, he will make something to eat.
spanish: Tan pronto como llegues, él va a hacer algo de comer.

english: Auguste Comte is regarded as the father of sociology.
spanish: Auguste Comte es considerado el padre de la sociología.

english: Better to die on our feet, than to live on our knees.
spanish: Es mejor morir de pie a vivir arrodillado.

english: Blood pressure is important as a barometer of health.
spanish: La presión arterial es importante como barómetro de la salud.

english: Buildings are much stronger now than they used to be.
spanish: Las construcciones son mucho más sólidas ahora de como solían serlo.

english: By the time you get out of prison, she'll be married.
spanish: Para cuando salgas de la cárcel, ella va a estar casada.

english: Cambridge is the most famous university in the world.
spanish: Cambridge es la universidad más famosa del mundo.

english: Can you fall in love with someone you have never met?
spanish: ¿Puedes enamorarte de alguien con quien jamás te has encontrado?

english: Compared to those around him, he looked really happy.
spanish: Comparado a los de alrededor, él se veía realmente feliz.

english: Confine your remarks to the matter we are discussing.
spanish: Restringe tus comentarios al asunto que estamos tratando.

english: Could you please tell me again where you put the key?
spanish: ¿Podrías decirme nuevamente dónde pusiste la llave, por favor?

english: Could you please tell me again where you put the key?
spanish: ¿Podrías repetirme dónde metiste la llave?

english: Could you translate this document into French for me?
spanish: ¿Puedes traducirme este documento al francés?

english: Crocodiles, snakes, lizards and turtles are reptiles.
spanish: Los Cocodrilos, las serpientes, las lagartijas y las tortugas son reptiles.

english: Cut the cheese into thin slices or into little cubes.
spanish: Corta el queso en rodajas finas o en cubos.

english: Cut the cheese into thin slices or into little cubes.
spanish: Cortá el queso en rodajas finas o en cubos.

english: Cutting a cake into equal pieces is rather difficult.
spanish: Partir una tarta en partes iguales es bastante complicado.

english: Did Tom talk to you about his plans for next weekend?
spanish: ¿Tom te habló de sus planes para el próximo fin de semana?

english: Did you believe in Santa Claus when you were a child?
spanish: ¿Creías en Santa Claus cuando eras niño?

english: Do you know who the Japanese ambassador to France is?
spanish: ¿Sabe quién es el embajador japonés en Francia?

english: Do you know why spring rolls are called spring rolls?
spanish: ¿Sabes por qué al arrollado primavera le dicen arrollado primavera?

english: Do you know why spring rolls are called spring rolls?
spanish: ¿Sabes por qué los rollitos primavera se llaman rollitos primavera?

english: Do you see that cloud that almost looks like a camel?
spanish: ¿Ves esa nube que casi parece camello?

english: Do you think you could teach me to play the bagpipes?
spanish: ¿Crees que podrías enseñarme a tocar la gaita?

english: Don't tell Tom about what we plan to do next weekend.
spanish: No le cuentes a Tom lo que planeamos hacer el próximo fin de semana.

english: Don't trust any statistics you did not fake yourself.
spanish: No confíes en ninguna estadística que no hayas fabricado tú.

english: Don't you want to know what Tom really thinks of you?
spanish: ¿No querés saber lo que Tom realmente piensa de vos?

english: Drivers must look out for children crossing the road.
spanish: Los conductores deben poner ojo con los niños cruzando la calle.

english: Employers expect their employees to give 110 percent.
spanish: Los jefes esperan que sus empleados rindan un 110 %.

english: Even though he's a policeman, he's afraid of thieves.
spanish: A pesar de que él es policía, los ladrones le dan miedo.

english: Even though it sounds strange, what she said is true.
spanish: Por más extraño que suene, lo que ella dijo es verdad.

english: Every now and then I like to have hot and spicy food.
spanish: Me gusta comer comida caliente y picante de vez en cuando.

english: Everybody does stupid stuff like that in high school.
spanish: Todos cometen estupideces así en la escuela.

english: Everyone wants me to go, but I don't feel like going.
spanish: Todos quieren que vaya, pero no estoy con ánimo de ir.

english: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
spanish: Los hechos no dejan de existir por ser ignorados.

english: Finishing the job by Tuesday will be a piece of cake.
spanish: Será fácil acabar este trabajo antes del martes.

english: First cousins have one set of grandparents in common.
spanish: Los primos hermanos tienen una pareja de abuelos en común.

english: Flight 101 from Paris arrived one hour ahead of time.
spanish: El vuelo 101 proveniente de París llegó una hora antes de tiempo.

english: For the most part, I enjoy watching all sports on TV.
spanish: Generalmente, me gusta ver todos los deportes en la tele.

english: God loves you and has a wonderful plan for your life.
spanish: Dios te ama y tiene un maravilloso plan para tu vida.

english: Have you ever walked through a graveyard at midnight?
spanish: ¿Alguna vez has caminado a través de un cementerio a medianoche?

english: Have you visited the town where your father was born?
spanish: ¿Has visitado la ciudad en que nació tu padre?

english: He can mask his feeling if the occasion calls for it.
spanish: Puede ocultar sus sentimientos si la ocasión lo requiere.

english: He completely failed to understand why she got angry.
spanish: Él fracasó completamente en entender por qué ella se había enojado.

english: He couldn't speak because the audience was too noisy.
spanish: No pudo hablar porque la audiencia era demasiado ruidosa.

english: He did not hesitate in taking his share of the money.
spanish: No dudó en coger su parte del dinero.

english: He does not study hard, but does very well at school.
spanish: No estudia mucho, pero le va muy bien en el colegio.

english: He does nothing but complain from morning till night.
spanish: No hace más que quejarse todo el día.

english: He failed the exam because he had not studied enough.
spanish: Él suspendió el examen porque no había estudiado lo suficiente.

english: He finally realized that Mary had made a fool of him.
spanish: Finalmente se dio cuenta de que Mary se había burlado de él.

english: He gave me an orange in exchange for a piece of cake.
spanish: Él me dio una naranja a cambio de un trozo de tarta.

english: He gave me an orange in exchange for a piece of cake.
spanish: Me dio una naranja a cambio de un trozo de tarta.

english: He hid his emotions and pretended to be enthusiastic.
spanish: Ocultó sus sentimientos y fingió estar entusiasmado.

english: He is a nice person, to be sure, but not very clever.
spanish: Él es una persona maja, estate seguro, pero no muy listo.

english: He lives in a luxury apartment close to Central Park.
spanish: Vive en un apartamento de lujo cerca de Central Park.

english: He not only speaks English, he speaks French as well.
spanish: Él no solo habla inglés, también habla francés.

english: He said that he had been in California for ten years.
spanish: Él dijo que había estado por diez años en California.

english: He took out the wallet from his inside jacket pocket.
spanish: Él se sacó la cartera del bolsillo interior de su chaqueta.

english: He walked so fast that she couldn't keep up with him.
spanish: Él andaba tan deprisa que ella no podía seguirle el ritmo.

english: He was destined to become a simultaneous interpreter.
spanish: Él estaba destinado a convertirse en intérprete simultáneo.

english: He was honest, strong, and willing to make decisions.
spanish: Él fue honesto, fuerte y decidido para tomar decisiones.

english: He was looking around as if he was expecting someone.
spanish: Él miraba a su alrededor como si esperara a alguien.

english: He wears expensive clothes and owns a lot of jewelry.
spanish: Él lleva ropa cara y tiene muchas joyas.

english: He will telephone you immediately when he comes back.
spanish: Te llamará en cuanto vuelva.

english: He's not such a great writer and I think he knows it.
spanish: Él no es muy buen escritor, y creo que lo sabe.

english: He's very nice, which is why I like working with him.
spanish: Es muy simpático, por eso me gusta trabajar con él.

english: Headlines are supposed to grab the reader's interest.
spanish: Se supone que los encabezados capten el interés del lector.

english: Her brother is married, but he doesn't have children.
spanish: Su hermano es casado, pero no tiene hijos.

english: Her husband eats everything she puts in front of him.
spanish: Su esposo come todo lo que ella le ponga en frente.

english: His brother had been a truck driver for thirty years.
spanish: Su hermano había sido camionero durante treinta años.

english: His brother had been a truck driver for thirty years.
spanish: Su hermano llevaba treinta años siendo camionero.

english: His brother is married, but he doesn't have children.
spanish: Su hermano es casado, pero no tiene hijos.

english: His long absences were starting to provoke suspicion.
spanish: Sus prolongadas ausencias comenzaban a provocar sospecha.

english: His only wish was to see his son again one more time.
spanish: Su único deseo era volver a ver a su hijo una vez más.

english: His parents said that he should go to the university.
spanish: Sus padres dijeron que él debía ir a la universidad.

english: How did Tom manage to lose so much weight so quickly?
spanish: ¿Cómo consiguió Tom perder tanto peso tan pronto?

english: How did Tom manage to lose so much weight so quickly?
spanish: ¿Cómo pudo Tom perder tanto peso tan rápidamente?

english: How much money has been spent on building the museum?
spanish: ¿Cuánto dinero se ha gastado en la construcción del museo?

english: How much of what I've written here do you understand?
spanish: ¿Cuánto puedes entender de lo que he escrito aquí?

english: I always drink a glass of milk before going to sleep.
spanish: Siempre bebo un vaso de leche antes de irme a dormir.

english: I am more worried about you than the future of Japan.
spanish: Estoy más preocupado por ti que por el futuro de Japón.

english: I am not going out because I have to clean the house.
spanish: No voy a salir porque tengo que limpiar la casa.

english: I assure you I'll do everything possible to help you.
spanish: Te aseguro que haré todo lo posible para ayudarte.

english: I beg your pardon. I didn't think this was your seat.
spanish: Discúlpeme. No pensé que fuera su asiento.

english: I began to be afraid you would never come back again.
spanish: Yo comencé a temer que tú nunca volverías de nuevo.

english: I can't believe you actually did something like that.
spanish: No puedo creer que realmente hayas hecho algo así.

english: I can't figure out how to register a new domain name.
spanish: No llego a averiguar cómo se registra un nuevo nombre de dominio.

english: I can't for the life of me remember her phone number.
spanish: No hay manera de que me acuerde de su número de teléfono.

english: I can't remember where I put the good sewing machine.
spanish: No me puedo acordar de dónde puse la máquina de coser buena.

english: I can't see anything because the whole place is dark.
spanish: No veo nada porque en todas partes está oscuro.

english: I can't talk with my father without losing my temper.
spanish: No puedo hablar con mi padre sin perder los estribos.

english: I canceled my appointment because of urgent business.
spanish: Cancelé mi compromiso por asuntos urgentes.

english: I cannot help loving her in spite of her many faults.
spanish: No puedo dejar de amarla a pesar de sus defectos.

english: I caught sight of an old friend of mine in the crowd.
spanish: Vi a un viejo amigo mío entre la multitud.

english: I could not understand what prevented me from moving.
spanish: No pude entender que me impedía moverme.

english: I didn't want to catch a cold, so I didn't go skiing.
spanish: No quería coger un resfriado, así que no fui a esquiar.

english: I don't care what people think about the way I dress.
spanish: No me importa lo que la gente piense de cómo me visto.

english: I don't have a CD player, but I bought the CD anyway.
spanish: No tengo un reproductor de CDs, pero compré el CD de todas formas.

english: I don't have a lot of money, but I get along somehow.
spanish: No tengo mucho dinero, pero me las arreglo de una forma u otra.

english: I don't know whether he's younger or older than I am.
spanish: No sé si él es más joven o mayor que yo.

english: I don't think I could spend six hours alone with you.
spanish: No creo que pueda pasar seis horas a solas contigo.

english: I don't think I'd mind eating Chinese food every day.
spanish: No creo que me afectara comer comida china todos los días.

english: I don't want to get married, but I want to have kids.
spanish: No me quiero casar, pero quiero tener hijos.

english: I don't want to share the hotel room with a stranger.
spanish: No quiero compartir la habitación del hotel con un desconocido.

english: I don't want to talk about my relationship with Mary.
spanish: No quiero hablar de mi relación con Mary.

english: I don't want to think about what could have happened.
spanish: No quiero pensar en lo que podría haber pasado.

english: I forgot to shutter the windows before the storm hit.
spanish: Olvidé cerrar las contraventanas antes de que la tormenta golpeara.

english: I found my father's diary which he kept for 30 years.
spanish: Encontré el diario que mi padre mantuvo por 30 años.

english: I get the feeling you're trying to tell me something.
spanish: Tengo la impresión de que estás tratando de decirme algo.

english: I got up earlier than usual to catch the first train.
spanish: Me levanté más pronto de lo normal para coger el primer tren.

english: I had a bad headache. That's why I went to bed early.
spanish: Tenía un terrible dolor de cabeza, así que me fui a acostar temprano.

english: I had a hunch something pleasant was going to happen.
spanish: Tuve un presentimiento de que algo agradable iba a ocurrir.

english: I had forgotten that I had met her several years ago.
spanish: Había olvidado que hace varios años atrás la había conocido.

english: I had hardly left home when it began to rain heavily.
spanish: Apenas había salido de la casa cuando se puso a llover fuerte.

english: I had to bite my lip to prevent myself from laughing.
spanish: Tuve que morderme el labio para evitar reírme.

english: I hate to interrupt you, but I need to say something.
spanish: Odio interrumpirte, pero necesito decir algo.

english: I have an obligation to look out for Tom's interests.
spanish: Tengo la obligación de velar por los intereses de Tom.

english: I have been waiting for a friend of mine for an hour.
spanish: Llevo una hora esperando a un amigo mío.

english: I have no interest whatsoever in eating English food.
spanish: No tengo ningún interés en comer comida inglesa.

english: I have two sons. One is in Nara and the other in Tsu.
spanish: Tengo dos hijos. Uno está en Nara y el otro en Tsu.

english: I heard that both of your grandfathers were plumbers.
spanish: Escuché que tus dos abuelos eran fontaneros.

english: I hid myself for fear of being scolded by my teacher.
spanish: Me escondí por miedo a ser regañado por mi profesor.

english: I know I said I would do it, but I can't do it today.
spanish: Sé que dije que lo haría, pero hoy no puedo.

english: I know Tom's hiding something, but I don't know what.
spanish: Yo sé que Tom está ocultando algo, pero no sé qué.

english: I know it's difficult to believe, but it's the truth.
spanish: Sé que es difícil de creer, pero es la verdad.

english: I know it's not easy, but you've got to at least try.
spanish: Sé que no es fácil, pero al menos tienes que tratar.

english: I know someone who may be interested in your project.
spanish: Conozco a alguien que puede estar interesado en tu proyecto.

english: I know that the last thing you want to do is help me.
spanish: Sé que lo último que quieres es ayudarme.

english: I know we don't really know each other all that well.
spanish: Sé que no nos conocemos tan bien.

english: I like Roger Federer. What tennis player do you like?
spanish: Me gusta Roger Federer. ¿Qué tenista te gusta?

english: I like him a lot, but sometimes he gets on my nerves.
spanish: Ella me agrada mucho, pero a veces me saca de las casillas.

english: I like the arrangement of the furniture in this room.
spanish: Me agrada la ubicación de los muebles en esta sala.

english: I live in a town, but my parents live in the country.
spanish: Yo vivo en la ciudad, pero mis padres viven en el campo.

english: I love the fact that you always seem to care so much.
spanish: Me agrada el hecho de que siempre te parece importar tanto.

english: I love to spend time trying to put together a puzzle.
spanish: Me encanta pasar el tiempo intentando armar rompecabezas.

english: I pinched myself to make sure that I wasn't dreaming.
spanish: Me pellizqué para asegurarme de que no estaba soñando.

english: I plan to telephone Tom tomorrow and ask him to help.
spanish: Mañana planeo llamar a Tom y pedirle que ayude.

english: I prefer walking to driving in a big city like Tokyo.
spanish: Prefiero caminar antes que manejar en una gran ciudad como Tokio.

english: I ran into an old friend of mine outside the station.
spanish: Me encontré con un amigo de hace tiempo afuera de la estación.

english: I remember your face, but I don't remember your name.
spanish: Yo recuerdo tu rostro pero no recuerdo tu nombre.

english: I said, "Could you please turn your television down?"
spanish: Yo dije, "¿Podrías bajarle a tu televisor, por favor?"

english: I scribbled down his address in the back of my diary.
spanish: Garabateé su dirección en el dorso de mi diario.

english: I shouldn't have eaten the whole bag of potato chips.
spanish: No debí haberme comido la bolsa entera de papas fritas.

english: I shouldn't have to tell you to keep your room clean.
spanish: No debería tener que decirte que mantengas limpia tu habitación.

english: I shouldn't have walked home late at night by myself.
spanish: No debí haberme ido caminando a casa yo solo por la noche.

english: I spent a week in Berlin living with a German family.
spanish: Pasé una semana en Berlín viviendo con una familia alemana.

english: I think I'm going to buy myself a cellphone tomorrow.
spanish: Mañana pienso comprarme un móvil.

english: I think Tom is hurt. Blood is coming out of his head!
spanish: Creo que Tom está herido. ¡Le sangra la cabeza!

english: I think it's impossible for him to solve the problem.
spanish: Creo que para él es imposible resolver el problema.

english: I think it's time for me to consider going on a diet.
spanish: Creo que es hora de que considere hacer una dieta.

english: I think it's time for me to move into a smaller home.
spanish: Creo que es hora de que me mude a una casa más pequeña.

english: I think it's time for me to split some more firewood.
spanish: Creo que es hora de que parta un poco más de leña.

english: I think it's time for me to split some more firewood.
spanish: Creo que es hora de que pique un poco más de leña.

spanish: No puedo descubrir cómo postear un comentario en este blog.

spanish: Yo convencí a Tom de que fuera a Boston con Mary.

english: I convinced Tom that he should go to Boston with Mary.
spanish: Yo convencí a Tom de que se fuera para Boston con Mary.

english: I couldn't swim as well as the other kids in my class.
spanish: No pude nadar tan bien como los otros chicos de mi clase.

english: I didn't have enough space to fit my lunch in the bag.
spanish: No tenía suficiente espacio en mi mochila para poner mi almuerzo.

english: I didn't want to spend any more time arguing with Tom.
spanish: No quería perder más tiempo discutiendo con Tom.

english: I don't feel well and would rather stay at home today.
spanish: No me siento bien y preferiría quedarme en casa hoy.

english: I don't have a dress good enough for such an occasion.
spanish: No tengo un vestido decente para tal ocasión.

english: I don't know how long this situation is going to last.
spanish: No sé cuánto va a durar esta situación.

english: I don't know whether he will agree to our plan or not.
spanish: No sé si él va a estar de acuerdo con nuestro plan o no.

english: I don't know whether you are telling the truth or not.
spanish: No sé si estás diciendo la verdad o no.

english: I don't think I've made enough spaghetti for everyone.
spanish: No creo que haya hecho suficiente espagueti para todos.

english: I don't think television will take the place of books.
spanish: Yo no creo que la televisión vaya a reemplazar a los libros.

english: I don't want to hurt Tom any more than I already have.
spanish: No quiero lastimar a Tom más de lo que ya lo lastimé.

english: I don't want to hurt Tom any more than I already have.
spanish: No quiero lastimar a Tom más de lo que ya lo he hecho.

english: I doubt that Tom understands what I tried to tell him.
spanish: Dudo que Tom entendiera lo que trataba de decirle.

english: I failed to catch the last bus, and came home by taxi.
spanish: No alcancé el último bus y volví en taxi.

english: I fed my dog what I thought was good quality dog food.
spanish: Alimentaba a mi perro con lo que me parecía que era comida para perros de buena calidad.

english: I fed my dog what I thought was good quality dog food.
spanish: Alimentaba a mi perro con el pienso que me parecía de buena calidad.

english: I fed my dog what I thought was good quality dog food.
spanish: Alimentaba a mi perro con el alimento balanceado que me parecía de buena calidad.

english: I found something that I think you might want to read.
spanish: Encontré algo que creo que podrías querer leer.

english: I grabbed my little sister's hand and started running.
spanish: Cogí de la mano a mi hermana pequeña y eché a correr.

english: I had a feeling that something dreadful was happening.
spanish: Tenía la sensación de que algo malo estaba pasando.

english: I had an argument with Tom about the use of marijuana.
spanish: Discutí con Tom sobre el uso de la marihuana.

english: I had my brother correct the errors in my composition.
spanish: Mi hermano me corrigió los errores de la redacción.

english: I have a couple of friends who used to live in Boston.
spanish: Tengo un par de amigos que vivían en Boston.

english: I have a feeling that something is lacking in my life.
spanish: Tengo la sensación de que falta algo en mi vida.

english: I have a good sense of direction, so I don't get lost.
spanish: Tengo un buen sentido de la orientación, así que no me pierdo.

english: I have been to more than ten foreign countries so far.
spanish: Hasta ahora he estado en más de diez países extranjeros.

english: I hear that even taxi drivers often get lost in Tokyo.
spanish: He oído que incluso los taxistas se pierden en Tokio a menudo.

english: I heard Tom humming to himself while he washed dishes.
spanish: Escuché a Tom murmurándose a sí mismo mientras lavaba los platos.

english: I heard Tom speak French yesterday for the first time.
spanish: Ayer fue la primera vez que oí hablar a Tom en francés.

english: I just don't know why Tom doesn't want me to help him.
spanish: Simplemente no sé por qué Tom no quiere que le ayude.

english: I just want to let you know that I won't let you down.
spanish: Sólo quiero hacerte saber que yo no te defraudaré.

english: I just want to let you know that I won't let you down.
spanish: Solo quiero que sepas que no te decepcionaré.

english: I just wanted to tell you I ran into Tom this morning.
spanish: Solo quería decirte que me he encontrado con Tom esta mañana.

english: I knew I shouldn't have done it, but I did it anyways.
spanish: Sabía que no debí haberlo hecho, pero lo hice de todas formas.

english: I learned how to ride a bike when I was six years old.
spanish: Aprendí a montar en bicicleta cuando tenía seis años.

english: I live near the sea so I often get to go to the beach.
spanish: Voy seguido a la playa porque vivo cerca del mar.

english: I live near the sea so I often get to go to the beach.
spanish: Voy con frecuencia a la playa porque vivo cerca del mar.

english: I made use of every opportunity to improve my English.
spanish: Ocupé cada oportunidad para mejorar mi inglés.

english: I never would have thought that I would meet you here.
spanish: Nunca habría pensado encontrarte aquí.

english: I ran a red light in my car, because I was in a hurry.
spanish: Me pasé una luz roja en mi auto porque estaba apresurado.

english: I saw your light was on and knew you were still awake.
spanish: Vi que tenías la luz encendida y supe que todavía estabas despierto.

english: I should have reported it to the police, but I didn't.
spanish: Debería haber informado de ello a la policía, pero no lo hice.

english: I talked to Tom and Mary while I was waiting for John.
spanish: Hablé con Tom y Mary mientras estaba esperando a John.

english: I think it's highly unlikely that Tom will go bowling.
spanish: Creo que es altamente improbable que Tom vaya a jugar bolos.

english: I think it's time for me to get a new pair of glasses.
spanish: Creo que es hora de que consiga un nuevo par de anteojos.

english: I think you're the most beautiful girl I've ever seen.
spanish: Pienso que eres la niña más hermosa que jamás haya visto.

english: I thought Tom and Mary would have forgotten me by now.
spanish: Pensé que Tom y María se habrían olvidado de mí por ahora.

english: I thought Tom would ask Mary to go to Boston with him.
spanish: Pensé que Tom le pediría a María ir a Boston con él.

english: I thought Tom would ask Mary to go with him to Boston.
spanish: Pensé que Tom le pediría a María ir con él a Boston.

english: I thought Tom would at least understand the situation.
spanish: Pensé que Tom al menos comprendería la situación.

english: I thought we weren't supposed to go there without Tom.
spanish: Pensé que se suponía que no vamos allá sin Tom.

english: I thought you weren't going back for a couple of days.
spanish: Pensé que no ibas a volver por un par de días.

english: I took him to the most expensive restaurant on campus.
spanish: Le llevé al restaurante más caro del campus.

english: I want to live in a quiet city where the air is clean.
spanish: Quiero vivir en una ciudad apacible donde el aire sea limpio.

english: I want to remind you that you have a 2:30 appointment.
spanish: Quiero recordarte que tienes una cita a las 2:30.

english: I want to write my girlfriend a love letter in French.
spanish: Quiero escribirle una carta de amor en francés a mi novia.

english: I wanted to invite you, but your friend beat me to it.
spanish: Yo quería invitarle, pero su amigo se me adelantó.

english: I wanted to switch channel, but my wife didn't let me.
spanish: Quería cambiar de canal, pero mi esposa no me dejó.

english: I was lucky that I was able to find a good babysitter.
spanish: He tenido suerte de encontrar una buena canguro.

english: I was lucky that I was able to find a good babysitter.
spanish: He tenido suerte de encontrar una buena niñera.

english: I watched baseball on TV after I finished my homework.
spanish: Vi béisbol por la TV después de terminar mis deberes.

english: I wish I could eat some chocolate ice cream right now.
spanish: Ojalá pudiera comerme un poco de helado de chocolate ahora mismo.

english: I wish I could figure out how to convince Tom to stay.
spanish: Ojalá fuera capaz de averiguar cómo convencer a Tom de que se quedara.

english: I wish I could play the flute as well as Ian Anderson.
spanish: Desearía poder tocar la flauta traversa tan bien como Anderson.

english: I wonder if she'll recognize me after all these years.
spanish: Me pregunto si ella me reconocerá después de todos estos años.

english: I wonder why some people think black cats are unlucky.
spanish: Me pregunto por qué algunas personas piensan que los gatos negros dan mala suerte.

english: I would appreciate any information you can send to us.
spanish: Agradecería cualquier información que puedas enviarnos.

english: I would be grateful for your approval of this request.
spanish: Yo estaría agradecido por su aprobación a esta demanda.

english: I would go to the library if I had a car to get there.
spanish: Iría a la biblioteca si tuviera un auto para llegar allí.

english: I would've done it by myself if Tom hadn't been there.

english: I wouldn't be too surprised if this song became a hit.
spanish: No me sorprendería demasiado si esta canción se volviera un éxito.

english: I wrote down his phone number so I wouldn't forget it.
spanish: Me apunté su número de teléfono para no olvidarlo.

english: I'd like to be rich and not have to worry about money.
spanish: Me encantaría ser rico y no tener que preocuparme por dinero.

spanish: Quisiera alquilar el coche más barato que tenga por una semana.

english: I'll come at three o'clock if it is convenient to you.
spanish: Vendré a las tres si a usted le viene bien.

english: I'll have to tell my boss that I won't be in tomorrow.
spanish: Tendré que avisar a mi jefe que no vendré mañana.

english: I'll lend you the book as soon as I'm done reading it.
spanish: Te voy a prestar el libro apenas termine de leerlo.

english: I'll never tell anyone where I've hidden the treasure.
spanish: Nunca le diré a nadie dónde he escondido el tesoro.

english: I'm afraid you'll have to learn to live with the pain.
spanish: Me temo que tendrás que aprender a vivir con el dolor.

english: I'm going off to Vancouver next week to see my sister.
spanish: Voy a Vancouver la semana que viene a ver a mi hermana.

english: I'm planning to read as many books as I can this year.
spanish: Este año pienso leer todos los libros que pueda.

english: I'm probably the only person who can help you do that.
spanish: Soy probablemente la única persona que te puede ayudar a hacer eso.

spanish: He perdido mi pluma fuente. Tendré que comprarme una mañana.

english: If I had been rich, I would have given you some money.
spanish: Si hubiera sido rico, os habría dado dinero.

english: If I had been rich, I would have given you some money.
spanish: Si hubiera sido rico, te habría dado dinero.

spanish: Si tuviera dinero, saldría seguido y me divertiría.

spanish: Si yo te dijera todo lo que sé, te sorprenderías.

spanish: Si hace buen tiempo, voy a ir a nadar al río.

spanish: Si tan solo pudieras hablar inglés, serías perfecto.

spanish: Si no quieres estar solo, puedo hacerte compañía.

spanish: Si no quieres hacerlo por Tom, hazlo por mí.

spanish: Si no quieres ir ahí, entonces nosotros no iremos ahí.

spanish: Si salís tan descubierto, te vas a resfriar.

spanish: Si sales tan descubierta, te vas a resfriar.

spanish: Si sale tan desabrigado, se va a resfriar.

spanish: Si sale tan desabrigada, se va a resfriar.

english: If you had a time machine, which year would you visit?
spanish: Si tuvieras una máquina del tiempo, ¿qué año visitarías?

english: If you have something to say, say it now or pipe down.
spanish: Si tienes algo que decir, dilo ahora o cierra la boca.

english: If you need more information, we are happy to send it.
spanish: Si necesita más información, estaremos encantados de enviársela.

english: If you really want to know, all you have to do is ask.
spanish: Si realmente quieres saber sobre eso, todo lo que tienes que hacer es preguntar.

spanish: Si realmente quieres saber, solo debes preguntar.

english: If you really want to know, all you need to do is ask.
spanish: Si realmente quieres saber, todo lo que tienes que hacer es preguntar.

spanish: Si crees que te va a hacer feliz, ve y hazlo.

spanish: En China es mejor viajar con un guía.

spanish: Si quieres que te bese, solo tienes que pedírmelo.

spanish: Si no estás apurado, quedate un poco más, por favor.

spanish: Si tu hijo bebe veneno, llévalo rápidamente al hospital.

spanish: No hay una escuela para aprender esperanto en mi ciudad.

spanish: Se ha descubierto que fumar es malo para la salud.

spanish: Es absolutamente necesario que estés en la reunión.

english: It is impossible for me to finish the work in an hour.
spanish: Me va a resultar imposible terminar el trabajo en una hora.

spanish: Me resulta imposible acabar el trabajo en una hora.

spanish: Fue tonto de mi parte haber cometido dos veces el mismo error.

english: It is very kind of you to send me such a nice present.
spanish: Es muy lindo de tu parte que me mandes un obsequio tan lindo.

spanish: A mi parecer las imágenes hablan por sí solas.

spanish: Le tomó mucho tiempo a la policía para llegar a la isla.

spanish: Era casi imposible circular por esa calle.

spanish: Era difícil resistir el impulso de retorcerle el cuello a Tom.

spanish: Fue muy cortez de él ofrecer su asiento al anciano.

spanish: Tardará tres meses antes de que nuestra casa esté lista.

english: It will not be long before man can travel to the moon.
spanish: No pasará mucho tiempo antes de que el hombre pueda viajar a la luna.

english: It would be nice to spend the summer in the mountains.
spanish: Sería bueno pasar el verano en las montañas.

english: It's been three years since I started to study French.
spanish: Han pasado tres años desde que empecé a aprender francés.

english: It's pity that nobody came to meet you at the station.
spanish: Qué pena que nadie haya venido a la estación a recibirte.

english: It's quite difficult to master French in 2 or 3 years.
spanish: Es bastante difícil dominar el francés en 2, 3 años.

english: Italy has some of the best art galleries in the world.
spanish: Italia tiene algunas de las mejores galerías de arte del mundo.

english: John was born in a hospital and he died in a hospital.
spanish: John nació en un hospital y murió en un hospital.

english: John went back to work after a two-week hospital stay.
spanish: John volvió al trabajo después de estar hospitalizado dos semanas.

english: Keep in mind that smoking is not good for your health.
spanish: Ten en cuenta que fumar no es bueno para tu salud.

english: Let's not make any hasty decisions. Let's sleep on it.
spanish: No tomemos una decisión precipitada. Consultémoslo con la almohada.

english: Listen carefully and do exactly what I tell you to do.
spanish: Escucha atentamente y haz exactamente lo que te diga.

english: Look to the left and right before crossing the street.
spanish: Mira a la izquierda y a la derecha antes de cruzar la calle.

english: Make sure to turn off all the lights before going out.
spanish: Asegúrate de apagar todas las luces antes de salir.

english: Many families left to make a new life on the frontier.
spanish: Muchas familias se mudaron para comenzar una nueva vida en la frontera.

english: Many kinds of flowers come out in the middle of April.
spanish: Muchos tipos de flores salen en la mitad de Abril.

english: Many people prefer to cook with butter instead of oil.
spanish: Muchas personas prefieren cocinar con mantequilla en lugar de aceite.

english: Maruyama Park is a place where a lot of people gather.
spanish: El parque Maruyama es un sitio donde mucha gente se reune.

english: Mary can't come. She has to take care of her daughter.
spanish: Mary no puede venir. Tiene que cuidar a su hija.

english: Mary had a little lamb whose fleece was white as snow.
spanish: María tenía un cordero cuya lana era blanca como la nieve.

english: Mary said that she loved me, but I didn't believe her.
spanish: Mary dijo que me amaba, pero no le creí.

english: Mary said that she loved me, but I didn't believe her.
spanish: María dijo que me amaba, pero no le creí.

english: Mary said that she loved me, but I didn't believe her.
spanish: Mary dijo que me amaba, pero no me lo creí.

english: Mary's dream of going abroad finally became a reality.
spanish: El sueño de María de viajar al extranjero finalmente se realizó.

english: Mary's dream of going abroad finally became a reality.
spanish: El sueño de Mary de ir al extranjero finalmente se hizo realidad.

english: Maybe I am unhappy, but I don't intend to kill myself.
spanish: Tal vez yo sea infeliz, pero no pretendo matarme.

english: Most of the people working here are unpaid volunteers.
spanish: La mayoría de las personas que trabajan aquí son voluntarios.

english: Much better to be woken by the birds than by an alarm.
spanish: Es mucho mejor ser despertado por los pájaros que por una alarma.

english: My English teacher has advised me to read these books.
spanish: Mi profesor de inglés me ha aconsejado leer estos libros.

english: My doctor has advised me to stop taking this medicine.
spanish: Mi médico me ha aconsejado dejar de tomar este medicamento.

english: My father took out his wallet and gave me ten dollars.
spanish: Mi padre sacó la billetera y me dio diez dólares.

english: My husband reads the newspaper while eating breakfast.
spanish: Mi marido lee el diario mientras desayuna.

english: My mother insists that I should not go out after dark.
spanish: Mi madre insiste en que no salga después de que oscurezca.

english: My parents told me that we should respect the elderly.
spanish: Mis padres me decían que debemos respetar a los mayores.

english: My phone has a caller ID that lets me screen my calls.
spanish: Mi teléfono tiene un identificador de llamadas que me permite filtrarlas.

english: My school is about ten minutes' walk from the station.
spanish: Mi colegio está a unos diez minutos a pie de la estación.

english: My uncle lived a happy life and died a peaceful death.
spanish: Mi tío tuvo una vida feliz y murió pacíficamente.

english: My youngest brother was brought up by our grandmother.
spanish: A mi hermano menor lo crió nuestra abuela.

english: Needless to say, health is more important than wealth.
spanish: No hace falta decir que la salud es más importante que la riqueza.

english: Next time, you should wear something more appropriate.
spanish: La próxima vez, deberías usar algo más apropiado.

english: No matter how hard she tried, she couldn't please him.
spanish: Ella no podía complacerlo por más que intentara.

english: No matter how you do it, the results will be the same.
spanish: No importa cómo lo hagas, los resultados serán los mismos.

english: No one can force you to do anything against your will.
spanish: Nadie puede obligarte a hacer algo contra tu voluntad.

english: No sooner had Tom turned on the TV than the fuse blew.
spanish: Tan pronto como Tom encendió la tele, se quemó el fusible.

english: Nothing we have done today has gone according to plan.
spanish: Nada de lo que hemos hecho hoy ha salido como lo planeamos.

english: One of Tom's friends was killed in a traffic accident.
spanish: Uno de los amigos de Tom murió en un accidente de tránsito.

english: One of the students raised his hand to ask a question.
spanish: Uno de los estudiantes levantó la mano para hacer una pregunta.

english: Our car was fast and soon got ahead of the other cars.
spanish: Nuestro coche fue rápido y pronto se puso por delante de los otros coches.

english: People who talk about themselves all the time bore me.
spanish: La gente que siempre habla de sí misma me aburre.

english: People who talk about themselves all the time bore me.
spanish: La gente que habla de sí misma todo el tiempo me aburre.

english: Perhaps we should go to Boston next week to visit Tom.
spanish: Tal vez deberíamos ir a Boston la próxima semana a visitar a Tom.

english: Perhaps you have misunderstood the aim of our project.
spanish: Puede que hayas entendido mal el objetivo de nuestro proyecto.

english: Perseverance, it is often said, is the key to success.
spanish: Se dice a menudo que la perseverancia es la clave del éxito.

english: Philosophy is not a thing one can learn in six months.
spanish: La filosofía no es algo que se pueda aprender en seis meses.

english: Please give me some kind of medicine to curb the pain.
spanish: Por favor, dame alguna medicina para frenar el dolor.

english: Please replace the empty ink cartridge in the printer.
spanish: Por favor reemplace el cartucho de tinta vacío de la impresora.

english: Please wait until I have finished writing this letter.
spanish: Por favor, espérese hasta que haya acabado de escribir esta carta.

english: Put the box wherever you can find room for it, please.
spanish: Pon la caja dondequiera que le encuentres espacio, por favor.

english: Salmon go up the river and lay their eggs in the sand.
spanish: El salmón va río arriba y pone sus huevos en la arena.

english: Salt was a rare and costly commodity in ancient times.
spanish: Antiguamente la sal era una comodidad rara y costosa.

english: Seen at a distance, the rock looked like a human face.
spanish: Vista a lo lejos, la roca se parecía a un rostro humano.

english: Seen from the sky, the river looked like a huge snake.
spanish: Visto desde el cielo, el río se parecía a una enorme serpiente.

english: Sega used to make video game consoles a long time ago.
spanish: Sega solía fabricar consolas de videojuego hace mucho tiempo.

english: She advised him to go abroad while he was still young.
spanish: Le aconsejó que fuera al extranjero mientras aún era joven.

english: She asked him why he was crying, but he didn't answer.
spanish: Ella le preguntó por qué lloraba, pero él no respondió.

english: She began doing her homework immediately after dinner.

spanish: Tuvo que dejar ir a su secretaría porque se casó.

spanish: Él colgó un viejo remo de madera en la pared como adorno.

spanish: Él rescató a una muchacha de ahogarse y obtuvo una recompensa.

spanish: Él se instaló en su silla a escuchar la música.

spanish: A veces se le olvida devolver los libros de la biblioteca.

spanish: Casi lo chocó un auto mientras cruzaba la calle.

spanish: Tiene un año y cinco meses, pero todavía no puede andar.

spanish: Sus padres eran terriblemente pobres y no pudieron enviar a su hijo a la universidad.

spanish: Su récord es un nuevo récord mundial en la carrera de cien metros.

spanish: Arrojé por accidente a la basura un cuchillo caro.
